resources.string:
About this app

Fieldwork typically involves using pen and paper because its the most portable option by far. This app aims (with exaggerated optimism) to be a worthy replacement for that.

In this sense, screen navigability aims to guide the census taker in defining data, from general to specific. Thus, the user will first create a Date, within which they will define Routes (as descriptors of geographic areas where census activities occur), and finally add as many Records as social units observed in the field.

This initial activity constitutes what can be called primary data, from which a series of modest yet powerful data interpretation tools will emerge.

Let the games begin, and may we triumph.

is an application was developed within the framework of the project "Temporal and spatial variation of the southern elephant seal colony in Península Valdés", to facilitate the collection and manipulation of scientific data related to the observation of southern elephant seals in their natural ecosystem.

The data generated and manipulated through this application are the property of the National Patagonian Center (CENPAT) through the Marine Macroecology Studies Group (GEMMA).
The use of this data is permitted exclusively for scientific purposes and must properly cite CENPAT and GEMMA as the original sources.

By using this application, you acknowledge and agree that:
1) You are manipulating and generating scientific data that belong to CENPAT
2) You must properly cite CENPAT and GEMMA for any use or publication of this data
3) Misuse of this data, as well as its dissemination without proper authorization, may be subject to penalties under the Personal Data Protection Law (Law No. 25,326) and the Access to Public Information Law (Law No. 27,275) applicable in the Argentine Republic
4) The data is subject to an open-use license with attribution (Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License - CC BY 4.0). This means that the data can be shared as long as proper credit is given to the creators, and authorization is obtained from them.

Copyright © 2024 National Patagonian Center (CENPAT). All rights reserved.

Deliver the records made with this device.\nThis app will function as a terminal
Request the records made on another device.\nThis app will function as a hub
The DB manager cannot verify the data integrity
For Haren without alpha, there should be no dominant males
For haren without alpha, there should be no peripheral males
For Haren without alpha, females must be >1
For harems group, the sum of dominant males must be >1
For harems group, females must be >1
This field is not editable for solitary pairs
For single individuals, there can be no dominant males
It must be AlfaS4Ad=1 or AlfaSams=1, choose only one
On the device you want to deliver your records, go to Export and press RECIPIENTS.\nThere, look for me as

Location permissions are required to obtain the current position
ImageView dimensions cannot be zero or negative

From the main menu we see all the options that this app offers.
 This section details the entry "%1$s" whose navigability seeks to guide the census taker in the definition of the data, from the general to the particular. Thus, first a Date will be registered, within this it will define Routes and finally it will add as many Records as social units observed in the field.

 This first activity constitutes the generation of primary data, and from it a series of data interpretation instruments that will be described later will be exploited.

Once within censuses, you will see the records grouped by year.

In case the database is empty, only the entry for the current year will be present.

 If you want to register a new record, click on the current year.

After selecting a year we see this screen, where we see the list of dates in which the recorded routes occurred.\n\n Additionally, the census taker may register the current date, if he wishes to carry out a census. For more details click on the \"?\" icon.

From the main menu we see all the options that this app offers.
 This section details the entry "%1$s" whose view aims to exploit the data obtained from the census on a map.
 Here you can cut the data by year and category (alpha male, female, breeding, peripheral male, etc).
 It also has a heat map to observe the relative concentration.
This screen shows a polyline for each route differentiated by color, in turn each route is made up of points that represent the registered social units.
This screen displays a heat map for the defined category. By clicking on the map you can see a detail of the density at that point.

From the main menu we see all the options that this app offers.
 This section details the "%1$s" entries in the side menu, located on the left of the screen and hidden by default. To unfold it, just drag your finger from left to right.

 These options are designed to manage two closely linked activities:
 a) %2$s: allows you to incorporate data generated from other instances of this same app, and data that respect a particular compatible csv scheme.
 b) %3$s: takes the entire local database, to share it with another instance of this same app, or a representative csv with all the categories, to be exploited in any external app or simply backup.

To enter you must drag your finger from left to right starting from the left side of the screen and towards the center.\n The other option is to press directly on the hamburger menu, highlighted in red in the image.
The menu has both options. Choose the first to add data to the existing database, and the second to extract all the data present in your app.
This list corresponds to dates from a year prior to the one we are spending
and therefore it is closed to add new entries, although you can see all its content
You have not added any date yet, so the list is empty. Click on (+) to add it
Now there is only one date registered. When you add more, you will notice the list. Click on the existing date to manage its routes
Click on the row representing the date of interest to continue to its detail. There you can manage the routes associated with the selected date
This screen represents a list of dates, where each one is represented by a row.
This list corresponds to tours from dates prior to today
and therefore it is closed to adding new entries, although you can see all its content
You have not added any route yet, so the list is empty. Click on (+) to add it
There is only one route registered. When you add more, you will notice the list. Click on the existing route to manage its records (census social units)
Click on the row representing the route of interest to continue to its detail. There you can manage the records (census social units) associated with the selected route
This screen represents a list of the routes made during a single date, where each route is represented by a row.
This list corresponds to records from dates prior to today
and therefore it is closed to add new entries, although you can see all its content
You have not added any record yet, so the list is empty. Click on (+) to add it
Now there is only one record registered. When you add more, you will notice the list. Click on the existing record to view its detail
Click on the row representing the record of interest to continue to its detail. There you can review the values defined during the observation of that social unit
This screen shows a list of records, where each record is represented by a row.
There is no data to graph

This category has all its null elements
